meanings.definition: The state or process that occurs when something is completely soaked or filled with a substance.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the ground reached saturation and could not absorb any more water.
meanings.sent2: The sponge reached saturation and could not hold any more liquid.
meanings.sent3: The towel was so full of water, it reached saturation and refused to dry anything else.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was at saturation with information overload, unable to process anything more.
meanings.sent5: The bucket was at saturation, overflowing with the rainwater it had collected.

meanings.definition: The state of being at full capacity or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The room was at saturation with people, not a single seat left empty.
meanings.sent2: The market reached saturation with vendors selling similar products.
meanings.sent3: The party was at saturation with excitement, everyone dancing and laughing.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were at saturation, unable to contain any more joy.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting were at saturation, vibrant and intense.

meanings.definition: The act of supplying or treating something with a substance until it can hold no more.
meanings.sent1: The chef achieved perfect saturation of flavors in the dish, every bite bursting with taste.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted experiments to reach saturation of the solution in the test tube.
meanings.sent3: The gardener carefully monitored the saturation of water in the soil to avoid overwatering.
meanings.sent4: The artist achieved saturation of color in the painting, creating a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic ensured the saturation of oil in the engine for optimal performance.
